What are the arguments required for the `importprivkey` command?

The `importprivkey` command requires at least one argument, which is the private key (as returned by `dumpprivkey`). The other two arguments, "label" and "rescan", are optional. "Label" is used to assign a label to the private key, and "rescan" is a boolean flag that specifies whether to rescan the wallet for transactions.

importprivkey "verusprivkey" ( "label" rescan ) Adds a private key (as returned by dumpprivkey) to your wallet. Arguments: 1. "verusprivkey"  (string, required) The private key (see dumpprivkey) 2. "label"      (string, optional, default="") An optional label 3. rescan        (boolean, optional, default=true) Rescan the wallet for transactions Note: This call can take minutes to complete if rescan is true. Examples: Dump a private key > verus dumpprivkey "myaddress" Import the private key with rescan > verus importprivkey "mykey" Import using a label and without rescan > verus importprivkey "mykey" "testing" false As a JSON-RPC call > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "importprivkey", "params": ["mykey", "testing", false] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
